itemDescription: British politician, writer, traveller and patron of the arts (1800-1857)

wikipedia_page.main: Francis Egerton, 1st Earl of Ellesmere,  (1 January 1800 – 18 February 1857), known as Lord Francis Leveson-Gower until 1833, was a British politician, writer, traveller and patron of the arts. Ellesmere Island, a major island (10th in size among global islands) in Nunavut, the Canadian Arctic, was named after him.
